page.title: 01INTRODUCING THEDDINGWORTH
page.content: Our block consists of agricultural land in S.E. Leicestershire with the village of THEDDINGWORTH occupying the top of a narrow ridge running E-W for about half a mile. The river Welland to the south separates us from Northamptonshire. The Grand Union canal and the embankment of the disused LMS railway run on the north side parallel to the ridge. We have described the{local history} and{ecology}of this block, the present {housing}and{home life.}We have written of{farming,}the{villagers,}their {employment}and{interests. Even though the volume and noise of the traffic along the busy A427 through the village might be regarded as a disincentive to active village life, the extent of the{interests}and {activities}we describe show that this is a lively and friendly village.
